title: 544-B
statement: B. Sea and Islandstime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputA map of some object is a rectangular field consisting ofnrows andncolumns. Each cell is initially occupied by the sea but you can cover some some cells of the map with sand so that exactlykislands appear on the map. We will call a set of sand cells to beislandif it is possible to get from each of them to each of them by moving only through sand cells and by moving from a cell only to a side-adjacent cell. The cells are called to be side-adjacent if they share a vertical or horizontal side. It is easy to see that islands do not share cells (otherwise they together form a bigger island).Find a way to cover some cells with sand so that exactlykislands appear on then×nmap, or determine that no such way exists.InputThe single line contains two positive integersn,k(1 ≤n≤ 100,0 ≤k≤n2) — the size of the map and the number of islands you should form.OutputIf the answer doesn't exist, print "NO" (without the quotes) in a single line.Otherwise, print "YES" in the first line. In the nextnlines print the description of the map. Each of the lines of the description must consist only of characters'S'and'L', where'S'is a cell that is occupied by the sea and'L'is the cell covered with sand. The length of each line of the description must equaln.If there are multiple answers, you may print any of them.Youshould notmaximize the sizes of islands.ExamplesInput5 2OutputYESSSSSSLLLLLSSSSSLLLLLSSSSSInput5 25OutputNO

processed.result:
You are given a rectangular grid of size $n \times n$.  Initially, the entire grid is filled with water. You can place sand on some of the cells to create islands. An island is a group of connected sand cells where you can move between any two cells in the group by only moving to horizontally or vertically adjacent cells.

Your task is to determine if it's possible to place sand on exactly $k$ cells to create $k$ distinct islands. If it's possible, output "YES" followed by a representation of the grid where 'S' represents water and 'L' represents sand. If it's not possible, output "NO". 



Let me know if you'd like me to elaborate on any part of the problem!

You are given a grid of squares.  You can fill some squares with sand.  The goal is to fill the squares with sand so that there are exactly *k* separate groups of connected sand squares (islands).  Determine if this is possible. If so, show one way to do it.
